item.title: So now George Bush Sr is celebrated as a titan of unity. How on earth did we get here? - The Guardian
item.description:
So now George Bush Sr is celebrated as a titan of unity. How on earth did we get here?  The Guardian

George HW Bush was no one’s idea of a great president. His 1988 presidential campaign was the first I followed as a child in the US – supporting, under my mother’s instruction, his hapless rival, Michael Dukakis – and even then he seemed strangely unquantifiable, a blank. His presidency bore this impression out, in which his credit sheet was cancelled out by enough debit that the balance ultimately came to nothing. A war hero and famously polite, Bush Sr signed the Clean Air Act and the Americans With Disabilities Act (protecting, among others, people with HIV, from discrimination), and eve...

item.title: Secret Service formally terminates ‘Timberwolf Detail’ protecting President George H.W. Bush - MarketWatch
item.description:
Secret Service formally terminates ‘Timberwolf Detail’ protecting President George H.W. Bush  MarketWatch

ASSOCIATED PRESS By Associated Press A hearse carrying the casket of President George H.W. Bush arriving Thursday at Texas A&M University in College Station, Texas. Reuters COLLEGE STATION, Texas (AP) — The U.S. Secret Service has ended its detail for George H.W. Bush after nearly 40 years of protecting the former president, who was known by the code name “Timberwolf.” The agency says its security detail officially ended at 6 a.m. Friday “with no incidents to report” following Bush’s burial Thursday at his presidential library at Texas A&M University. In its final notification, the Bush Pro...

item.title: A Presidency Without Humor - The New York Times
item.description:
A Presidency Without Humor  The New York Times

As with September’s memorial services for John McCain, expressions of mourning for George H.W. Bush — extolling the 41st president’s humility, loyalty, temperance, decency, bravery and devotion to public service — have contained thinly veiled rebukes of the current president. The sharpest one, I thought, came in Alan Simpson’s splendid eulogy at Washington National Cathedral. “He never lost his sense of humor,” the former senator from Wyoming said of his friend of more than 50 years. “Humor is the universal solvent against the abrasive elements of life. That’s what humor is. He never hated ...

item.title: Trump demands border wall money; shutdown showdown nears - The Associated Press
item.description:
Trump demands border wall money; shutdown showdown nears  The Associated Press

KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) — President Donald Trump said Friday that Congress should provide all the money he wants for his promised U.S.-Mexico border wall, and he called illegal immigration a "threat to the well-being of every American community." Trump spoke hours after signing a short-term spending bill that covers key government departments for two more weeks, until Dec. 21, setting up a pre-Christmas showdown over the wall. The president wants the next spending package to include at least $5 billion for the proposed wall. House Democratic leader Nancy Pelosi of California rejected that a d...

item.title: The Week in 7 Insane Photos: December 7, 2018 - The Daily Beast
item.description:
The Week in 7 Insane Photos: December 7, 2018  The Daily Beast

From George H.W. Bush's funeral to Santa spreading cheer in Caracas, The Daily Beast brings you the best photos of the week. Richard Gamboa, dressed up as Santa Claus, talks with a boy during the "Santa en las calles" (Santa in the streets) event donating toys, food, and clothes at the slum Cota 905 in Caracas, Venezuela December 1, 2018. Marco Bello/Reuters A winter swimmer swims in a pool carved out of a frozen lake at Beiling Park in minus 10 degrees Celcius air temperature on December 6, 2018 in Shenyang, Liaoning Province of China. VCG/Getty Jack Collins of Canada competes in the Snowb...

item.title: On Politics: The Biggest Stories of the Week - The New York Times
item.description:
On Politics: The Biggest Stories of the Week  The New York Times

From developments in the Russia inquiry to doubts about the China trade truce, it’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the biggest stories you might have missed (and some links if you’d like to read further). ___________________ The nation bade farewell to former President Bush. Former President George H.W. Bush was remembered at his funeral on Wednesday as a “kinder and gentler” leader who steered the country through storms at home and abroad. As bells tolled, choirs sang and flags flew at half-staff on Wednesday, the nation solemnly said goodbye to the 41st president....

item.title: Thousands Line Bush Funeral Train Route for Final Farewell - VOA News
item.description:
Thousands Line Bush Funeral Train Route for Final Farewell  VOA News

Thousands of people lined up along the route of the funeral train that was taking the remains of former President George H.W. Bush from Houston about 80 miles northwest to his final resting place, his presidential library in College Station, Texas, on Thursday, Dec. 6. The train is a Union Pacific Corp locomotive, numbered 4141 and bearing the name "George Bush 41" on the side. Bush, the 41st U.S. president, died last week in Texas at age 94. His remains were flown to Texas on Wednesday evening after a state funeral at Washington's National Cathedral attended by U.S. President Donald Trump,...

item.title: Trump surrounding himself with yes-men and yes-women - CNN
item.description:
Trump surrounding himself with yes-men and yes-women  CNN

Jen Psaki, a CNN political commentator, was the White House communications director and State Department spokeswoman during the Obama administration. She is vice president of communications and strategy at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace. Follow her at @jrpsaki. The opinions expressed in this commentary are solely those of the author. Read more opinion articles at CNN. In the olden days of presidential appointments and nominations, the focus was justifiably on the nominees -- their background, what their policy positions said about the role they would play in an administratio...

item.title: Pearl Harbor brought out the best in George Bush and others - CNN
item.description:
Pearl Harbor brought out the best in George Bush and others  CNN

H. W. Brands teaches history at the University of Texas at Austin. His new book is "Heirs of the Founders: The Epic Rivalry of Henry Clay, John Calhoun and Daniel Webster, the Second Generation of American Giants." The views expressed here are solely his. View more opinion articles on CNN. It's an accident of timing that the funeral of George H. W. Bush occurred within days of the anniversary of Pearl Harbor. But it's no accident that Americans have marked the passing of the former President with an outpouring of respect and admiration typically reserved for war heroes. They remember his pr...

item.title: Bernie Sanders Explains to Colbert Why Trump Is No George H.W. Bush - The Daily Beast
item.description:
Bernie Sanders Explains to Colbert Why Trump Is No George H.W. Bush  The Daily Beast

Scott Kowalchyk/CBS Senator Bernie Sanders is one of the many progressives “seriously considering” a run for the presidency in 2020. And he took one step closer to that eventuality on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert Thursday night. Ostensibly, Sanders was there to promote his latest book, Where We Go from Here: Two Years in the Resistance, but really he was there to pump up his base. Asked how he’s feeling after the midterm elections, Sanders answered, “A lot better now than before the midterms. Democrats won 40 seats, now control the House, won several governors’ seats and several hundr...

item.title: Trump Announces Nominees for UN, Attorney General - VOA News
item.description:
Trump Announces Nominees for UN, Attorney General  VOA News

U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday confirmed he will nominate State Department spokeswoman Heather Nauert to be the new Ambassador to the United Nations. He also announced William Barr to be the new U.S. Attorney General, a post Barr held under former President George H.W. Bush. VOA'S Jeff Custer reports from Washington. Originally published at - https://www.voanews.com/a/trump-announces-nominees-for-un-attorney-general/4691318.html

item.title: Kelly may depart in expected White House shakeup - The Associated Press
item.description:
Kelly may depart in expected White House shakeup  The Associated Press

WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump is inching closer to his long-teased major White House shake-up, gearing up for the twin challenges of battling for re-election and dealing with the Democrats' investigations once they take control of the House. The biggest piece of the shifting picture: Chief of Staff John Kelly's departure now appears certain. Trump announced Friday he was picking a new U.S. attorney genera l and a new ambassador to the U.N. , and at the same time two senior aides departed the White House to beef up his 2020 campaign. But the largest changes were still to come. Kel...

item.title: Trump nominates William Barr to be his next attorney general - CNN
item.description:
Trump nominates William Barr to be his next attorney general  CNN

President Donald Trump has decided to nominate former Attorney General William Barr to be the next permanent head of the Justice Department, the President told reporters Friday. "I want to confirm that Bill Barr, one of the most respected jurists in the country, highly respected lawyer, former attorney general under the Bush administration, a terrific man, a terrific person, a brilliant man," Trump said as he departed the White House. "I did not know him until recently when I went through the process of looking at people and he was my first choice from day one, respected by Republicans and ...

item.title: Texas Bids President George HW Bush Final Farewell - VOA News
item.description:
Texas Bids President George HW Bush Final Farewell  VOA News

At the end of rows of carefully placed flags along this Houston sidewalk, just outside the metal gates of West Oak Drive South, is a makeshift memorial filled with flowers and teddy bears, honoring a local resident who was, at least to Donna Platt who lives nearby, more than just a president. “Very nice, we would run into him, and not just me but all the neighbors, in the bank doing his banking business or in the grocery store — he liked to go to the grocery store — and it was just like saying hi to another neighbor,” she told VOA after taking a few pictures to document the memorial for pos...

item.title: Selective memory? George H. Bush’s passing elicits gushing tributes - RT
item.description:
Selective memory? George H. Bush’s passing elicits gushing tributes  RT

The passing of America's 41st President - George Herbert Walker #Bush - has led to an outpouring of honours and respect being paid. RT's Caleb Maupin looks at whether the assessment of his time in office, may have been tempered somewhat - by the current political climate... item.title: Bush's presidential funeral train first in nearly 50 years - The Associated Press
item.description:
Bush's presidential funeral train first in nearly 50 years  The Associated Press

SPRING, Texas (AP) — The locomotive was painted to resemble Air Force One, but George H.W. Bush joked that if it had been around during his presidency, he may have preferred to ride the rails rather than take to the skies. "I might have left Air Force One behind," Bush quipped during the 2005 unveiling of 4141, a blue and gray locomotive commissioned in honor of the 41st president and unveiled at Texas A&M University. On Thursday, that same 4,300-horsepower machine left a suburban Houston railyard loaded with Bush's casket for his final journey after almost a week of ceremonies in Washingto...

item.title: Former U.S. Attorney General Barr may return to job - Reuters
item.description:
Former U.S. Attorney General Barr may return to job  Reuters

Former U.S. Attorney General William Barr, who served under former President George H.W. Bush, is the leading candidate for the job as a permanent replacement for Jeff Sessions, a source familiar with the matter said on Thursday. Gavino Garay reports.

item.title: George HW Bush's funeral follows generations of tradition - ABC News
item.description:
George HW Bush's funeral follows generations of tradition  ABC News

Former President George HW Bush's state funeral encompassed four days of events, from his arrival in Washington to his burial in Texas. The guidelines for state funerals date back to the mid-1800s and have been shaped over time. Seating arrangements, for example, are detailed with precision, with the presidential party followed by chiefs of state, arranged alphabetically by the English spelling of their countries. Ronald Reagan's state funeral in 2004 was the first of its kind since Lyndon Johnson died in 1973. Gerald Ford's state funeral overlapped the end of 2006 and the beginning of 2007...

item.title: Texas Bids President George H.W. Bush Final Farewell - VOA News
item.description:
Texas Bids President George H.W. Bush Final Farewell  VOA News

After formal services at the National Cathedral in Washington, the final journey for President George H.W. Bush takes place in the state that launched his political career, and where he is now finally laid to rest. VOA's Kane Farabaugh reports on how those in Texas participated in the final ceremonies to honor and remember their former president and war hero. Originally published at - https://www.voanews.com/a/texas-bids-president-george-h-w-bush-final-farewell/4690646.html

item.title: Trump to Nominate William Barr as Attorney General - VOA News
item.description:
Trump to Nominate William Barr as Attorney General  VOA News

A former U.S. attorney general known for supporting sweeping presidential powers is President Donald Trump's choice to again run the U.S. Department of Justice. Trump said Friday that William Barr, who was attorney general during the administration of the late former President George H.W. Bush, is his selection, describing him as "a terrific man, a terrific person, a brilliant man." The president told reporters at the White House that Barr, a 68-year-old conservative Republican and corporate lawyer, "was my first choice from day one. Respected by Republicans and respected by Democrats." Lat...

item.title: Notebook: In Washington, Sending Off the Old Normal - The New York Times
item.description:
Notebook: In Washington, Sending Off the Old Normal  The New York Times

On Thursday morning, as I was walking through downtown Washington and up to Capitol Hill, workers were carting away the last of the metal security barriers that had been erected around the Capitol, where George H.W. Bush lay in state earlier in the week. His coffin was sent off to Houston on Air Force One the previous afternoon, and on the Hill there was a feeling that the circus had left town — or, maybe, the opposite. “Oh, did he tweet something?” an editor was saying when I walked into the office, mumbling to no one in particular but loud enough to hear over TVs tuned to the Bush funeral...

item.title: 🇺🇸 'A great-soldier statesman': US bids farewell to George HW Bush | Al Jazeeras English - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
🇺🇸 'A great-soldier statesman': US bids farewell to George HW Bush | Al Jazeeras English  Al Jazeera English

The body of former US President George H W Bush has been flown to Texas where he will be buried this week. He died in his Houston home on Friday at the age of 94. Earlier, politicians past and present were among the mourners at a state funeral for the 41st president in Washington, DC. Al Jazeera's Kimberly Halkett reports from Washington, DC. - Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/ #GeorgeHWBush #GeorgeHWBush #41stUSPre...

item.title: The Power of Supreme Court Choices - The New York Times
item.description:
The Power of Supreme Court Choices  The New York Times

Correction: December 6, 2018 This article has been revised to reflect the following correction: An earlier version of this article misstated the result of the Senate vote on Brett Kavanaugh's nomination to the Supreme Court. He was confirmed by a vote of 50 to 48, not 50 to 42. It’s not hard for a new president, in concert with Congress, to erase a predecessor’s legislative, regulatory and diplomatic accomplishments. It’s a president’s Supreme Court legacy that lasts. Many retrospectives on the life of President George H.W. Bush, who died last Friday, noted that one of the two men he named ...

item.title: The week in 25 photos - CNN
item.description:
The week in 25 photos  CNN

Former US President George W. Bush speaks at the state funeral of his father, former US President George H.W. Bush, on Wednesday, December 5. "He showed me what it means to be a President who serves with integrity, leads with courage and acts with love in his heart for the citizens of our country," Bush said in his eulogy. See more photos of people paying their respects Alex Brandon/AP This aerial photo, taken on Friday, November 30, shows damage on Vine Road, south of Wasilla, Alaska, after a magnitude 7.0 earthquake. Marc Lester/AP The US Supreme Court, with newest member Brett Kavanaugh,...
